ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Questions on Charm
ygData.msgSnippet: For me, it seems that charm (tell it to attack), then Anthem, damage shield (or hymn), then *brief* pause, charm again.  The brief pause is about 1 sec or
ygData.messageBody:
For me, it seems that charm (tell it to attack), then Anthem, damage
shield (or hymn), then *brief* pause, charm again. The brief pause is about
1 sec or less, but yes, I can't keep all 3 songs going in perfect harmony
like normal :(

Of couse my having a pet that does 3x as much damage as me makes up for it
=)

So yes, the timing is just a *bit* screwy, it's that pause you have to work
on.

And of course all of this is assuming 1. it doesn't break charm early 2.
It doesn't resist charm, but those are to be expected.

Bien
p.s. BTW, has anyone ever heard a wierd *boiiiiing* sound when lizzies are
casting? It usually happens when I charm them, and they try to damage cast
on me, but I'm protected, but not always

p.p.s When charming, you might want to think about charming the casters. 1.
They do some mighty damage 2. They seem to run out of mana during a long
fight :) Unfortunately, if they start a heal before you charm them, they
still heal the mob :(



> From: "Adam Wasserman" <wassermana@...>
>
> Hi all,
>
> I've recently aquired the much coveted (by me at least) charm song. I've
> done some limited experimenting, mostly on very light greens so that I can
> get the hang of it, however I'm finding the timing of this song to be
> something I just can't grasp.
>
> Generally I select a target, Charm, swtich targets and attack, Selo's,
> Hymn,
> they back to charm.
>
> Unfortunately, I seem to charm too early every single time, the mob breaks
> charm and I get beat on for a full cycle while I try to get charm going
> again.
>
> I was wondering if any of the more experienced bards on the list could
> offer
> any tips on timing this so that I can start singing charm as the mob is
> about to break out, rather than waiting until I get pounded.
>
> I realize that I'll need to put in a lot of practice and that it will be
> hard to break the ingrained habit of making sure all my songs overlap.
> Just
> figured I'd appeal to the list before spending 3 hours in teh newbie area
> perfecting my timing.
>
